item.title: Points Don't Save [PI]
item.dc:creator: @beale beale
item.description:
@beale wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:8, topic:552226”]All 3 of them are not loading because you have the saving tokens mismatched from the reading tokens…
What you’re saving:
“QuestComplete”
“talkedToMonk”
"don-Points"
And what you’re loading:
“talked-to-monk”
“Quest-Complete”
“don-points”

Please make sure that they’re the same… Both in capitalization and how it’s spelled (Special characters included)[/quote]

Thanks Man

Read full topic

item.title: Points Don't Save [PI]
item.dc:creator: @beale beale
item.description:
@beale wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:2, topic:552226”]When you say “They’re not saving” do you mean:
The token"QuestComplete" (and the others) is not found within the the player save?
or do you mean:
“QuestComplete” (and the others) are always set to 0?

Because those are two different scenarios.
A) would mean it’s not writing.
B) would mean it’s probably not loading.[/quote]

second one. Everytime i re log after setting it to something other than 0, it reverts back to 0.

Read full topic

item.title: Points Don't Save [PI]
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

When you say “They’re not saving” do you mean:
The token"QuestComplete" (and the others) is not found within the the player save?
or do you mean:
“QuestComplete” (and the others) are always set to 0?

Because those are two different scenarios.
A) would mean it’s not writing.
B) would mean it’s probably not loading.

Read full topic

item.title: Points Don't Save [PI]
item.dc:creator: @beale beale
item.description:
@beale wrote:

Well, when i have a couple ints that aren’t saving even though I have them in playersave.java. Problem is, i can give myself 10 donor points (I just used 10 as an example) and when i relog my point count is back to zero. It is the same for 2 other ints too. Here is my playersave.java

characterfile.write("QuestComplete = " + Integer.toString(p.questComplete)); characterfile.newLine(); characterfile.write("talkedToMonk = " + Integer.toString(p.talkedToMonk)); characterfile.newLine(); characterfile.write("don-Points = " + Integer.toString(p.donPoints)); characterfile.newLine();

here are the ints

int talkedToMonk = 0; int questComplete = 0; int donPoints = 0;

Read full topic
